sections.title: Driver License Renewal (تجديد رخصة القيادة)
sections.text: To renew a driver license through Absher, the remaining validity must be less than 365 days from current date. Requirements: (1) Valid medical report from Efada system (Ministry of Health) - if missing, error 'عفواً، لا يمكن التجديد لعدم توفر التقرير الطبي' appears and user must visit authorized medical centers registered in Efada, (2) All outstanding traffic violations must be paid first, (3) Payment of government service fees is required but the official fee amount is calculated automatically by the Absher system during checkout. License types: private vehicle (رخصة قيادة خصوصية) and motorcycle (رخصة دراجة نارية). Renewal durations available include 2 years, 5 years, and 10 years. If more than 365 days remain on license, error 'المدة المتبقية من صلاحية رخصة القيادة أكثر من 365 يومًا' appears. Late renewals beyond 60 days after expiry may incur penalty fees determined by the system. Access: Absher > My Services > Traffic Services > Driver License Renewal.

sections.title: Driver License - User Roles and Permissions
sections.text: Four roles can renew licenses in Absher: (1) Principal User (المستفيد الأصيل) - the license owner, requires Nafath biometric verification, cannot renew if national ID or Iqama expired, (2) Delegate (المفوض) - person authorized via electronic delegation system under 'Traffic Services' category with valid active delegation period, (3) Guardian (الولي) - parent or legal guardian for minor dependents verified through National Information Center family records without needing explicit delegation, (4) System Actor (النظام الآلي) - automated notifications only, no transaction permissions. Each role has specific permissions and verification requirements documented in audit logs with initiator ID and beneficiary ID.

sections.title: Vehicle Registration Renewal - Istimara (تجديد رخصة السير - الاستمارة)
sections.text: Renewing vehicle registration (Istimara/استمارة) requires: (1) Valid periodic vehicle inspection certificate from authorized centers, (2) Active vehicle insurance policy verified through CCHI or Najm, (3) All traffic violations on vehicle or owner must be paid, (4) Payment of government service fees, with fee amount automatically determined by the Absher system. Cannot renew without completing vehicle inspection and having valid insurance. Access: Absher > My Vehicles > Select Vehicle > Renew Vehicle Registration. After payment confirmation, new Istimara is issued electronically and can be printed or delivered via Saudi Post (SPL). System automatically verifies insurance and inspection status before allowing renewal.

sections.title: Traffic Violations Inquiry (الاستعلام عن المخالفات المرورية)
sections.text: Absher provides comprehensive traffic violations inquiry service accessible via ID number, vehicle plate number, or mobile number. Access: Absher > Traffic Services > Inquiries > Traffic Violations Inquiry. Enter ID number or Iqama number and verification code to view all violations with details including: violation type, date, location, fine amount, violation status (paid/unpaid). Users can view violations for themselves and family members. Violations must be paid before renewing driver license, vehicle registration, or certain passport/visa services. Payment available through SADAD system directly from Absher or through banking apps. System displays total violations amount and allows filtering by date or status.

sections.title: Vehicle Insurance Validity Inquiry (الاستعلام عن صلاحية التأمين)
sections.text: Service allows inquiry about vehicle insurance validity through Absher platform. Access: Absher > Vehicle Services > Inquiries > Insurance Validity Inquiry. Required data: ID number or Iqama number, vehicle plate number, verification code. System displays: policy status (active/expired), insurance company name, start and end dates, coverage type. Insurance verification is mandatory for vehicle registration renewal and ownership transfer. System integrates with CCHI and Najm for real-time insurance verification.

sections.title: Vehicle Ownership Transfer (مبايعة المركبات إلكترونياً)
sections.text: Electronic vehicle sale through Absher requires: (1) Vehicle must not be flagged as seized (محجوزة), stolen (مفقودة), security-wanted (مطلوبة أمنياً), or suspended (موقوفة), (2) Valid periodic inspection certificate from Mujaz system - error 'الفحص الدوري منتهي الصلاحية' if expired, (3) Buyer must purchase valid insurance verified through CCHI or Najm before transfer, (4) No blocking violations for either party. Payment mechanism: buyer transfers amount to a system-managed escrow account (حساب وسيط/ضامن). Upon successful transfer, the system releases funds to seller. If transfer fails, refund is automatically issued to buyer. OTP verification code is sent to seller during process as confirmation at vehicle handover.

sections.title: Vehicle Driving Authorization - Tafweed (تفويض قيادة المركبة)
sections.text: Allows vehicle owner to authorize another person to drive. Two types: (1) Internal Authorization (داخلية) for driving within Saudi Arabia, requiring the authorized person to have a valid Saudi driver license, (2) External Authorization (خارجية) for GCC driving, requiring additional checks including no final exit visa for residents. Maximum authorization duration is 6 months. Vehicle registration must remain valid throughout period. Error 'المفوض له (مقيم) لديه خروج نهائي' appears if resident has final exit visa. Common uses: family members sharing a vehicle, private drivers, temporary business travel. Access: Absher > Vehicle Services > Vehicle Authorization.

sections.title: Vehicle Details and Status Inquiry (الاستعلام عن تفاصيل المركبة)
sections.text: Access detailed vehicle information through: Absher > My Vehicles > Select Vehicle > Vehicle Details. Displays: make/model, registration number, chassis number, Istimara expiry, insurance status, outstanding violations, plate details, ownership history. Users may check if vehicle is seized through: Absher > Vehicle Services > Inquiries > Seized Vehicles Inquiry. System shows seizure location, date, and reason. Updated in real-time.

sections.title: Exit and Re-Entry Visa (تأشيرة الخروج والعودة)
sections.text: Exit/re-entry visa issuance requires: (1) Zero traffic violations, otherwise 'يوجد مخالفات مرورية يجب سدادها', (2) Passport validity at least 90 days beyond visa period, otherwise 'صلاحية الجواز أقل من المدة المطلوبة', (3) Iqama validity sufficient for full visa duration, (4) Fingerprint biometric enrolled. Visa types: single-trip and multiple-trip visas; fees and payment amounts are automatically calculated by Absher. Only sponsor (الكفيل) can issue for workers; head of household can issue for dependents. System sends alerts before expiry. Access: Absher > Passport Services > Exit/Re-entry Visa.

sections.title: Residency Iqama Renewal (تجديد الإقامة)
sections.text: Iqama renewal requires: (1) Valid health insurance linked to CCHI; without it, error 'لا يوجد تأمين طبي ساري في مجلس الضمان' appears, (2) For private sector employees, valid work permit (رخصة عمل) verified via MHRSD, (3) No conflicting status such as expired ID or unresolved violations. Dependent and worker fees are calculated automatically by Absher during payment. Renewal allowed up to 6 months before expiry. Late renewals may incur penalties. Access: Absher > Passport Services > Iqama Renewal.

sections.title: Travel Permits for Dependents (تصاريح السفر للتابعين)
sections.text: Service allows guardians to issue travel permits for dependents under 21. Access: Absher > Family Members Services > Travel Permits. Two types: (1) National ID-based permit for GCC travel only, (2) Passport-based permit for international travel. Permit stored digitally and verified at borders. Status inquiry available under Passport Services > Inquiries > Travel Permit Status.

sections.title: Saudi Passport Issuance and Renewal (إصدار وتجديد جواز السفر السعودي)
sections.text: Citizens may request new passport issuance or renewal through Absher. Requirements: valid national ID with fingerprint, all violations paid, presence inside Saudi Arabia during request, and correct guardian permissions for users under 21. Passport validity options include 5 years or 10 years (10-year option for age 21+). Applicable government fees are calculated automatically by Absher. Delivery available through Saudi Post (SPL). Processing typically takes 2 business days.

sections.title: Passport Updates for Dependents and Domestic Workers (تحديث جوازات المرافقين والعمالة)
sections.text: Allows updating passport information (number, issue date, expiry date, issuing country) for dependents and domestic workers through the sponsor's Absher account. Actual passport renewal for domestic workers must be done at their embassy; Absher only updates the information afterward. Requirements: sponsor must have no security issues, beneficiary must be present inside Saudi Arabia, and passport must have sufficient remaining validity (typically 12+ months). Access: Absher > Passport Services > Update Passport Information.

sections.title: National ID Renewal (تجديد الهوية الوطنية)
sections.text: Citizens may renew national ID electronically through Absher using AI-powered facial recognition. Requirements include a compliant photo: white background, no sunglasses or colored lenses, centered face. Delivery available through national address or pickup. Renewal validity period depends on age category. Payment is required but the official fee is calculated automatically by Absher. Users may track status under: Inquiries > National ID Renewal Status.

sections.title: Family Registry for Mothers (إصدار سجل الأسرة للأمهات)
sections.text: Service allows Saudi mothers to obtain a family registry document proving relationship with their children. Requirements: Saudi nationality, marital status (married/divorced/widowed), at least one child linked in National Information Center, and valid national address. Access: Absher > Civil Affairs Services > Family Registry for Mothers. Document delivered via Saudi Post (SPL).

sections.title: Family Registry Issuance for Newlyweds (إصدار سجل الأسرة لحديثي الزواج)
sections.text: Newly married Saudi citizens may electronically request a family registry. Requirements include a registered marriage contract and valid national address. Document delivered via Saudi Post. Processing typically 3–5 days.

sections.title: Birth Registration (تسجيل المواليد)
sections.text: Parents may register newborn births electronically. Required information: hospital, birth date, mother and father IDs, proposed name. System verifies record with hospital database. Birth certificate issued electronically and delivered or picked up. Must be completed within designated time to avoid complications.

sections.title: Lost National ID Reporting (الإبلاغ عن الهوية المفقودة)
sections.text: Reporting a lost national ID immediately revokes the digital identity and marks the ID as invalid in all systems. Replacement requires uploading a compliant photo, passing AI validation, and completing payment (fee calculated automatically). Replacement ID keeps the same ID number but uses a new serial number. Access: Absher > Civil Affairs Services > Report Lost ID.

sections.title: Absher Delegation System (تفويض خدمات أبشر)
sections.text: Users may issue electronic delegations to authorize others to perform specific Absher services. Two types: (1) Digital services delegation for online execution, (2) Physical office delegation for in-person service execution. Delegator specifies delegate ID, service category, and validity dates. Delegations may be canceled anytime. Actions performed by delegates are logged with audit trails.

sections.title: Transfer of Services - Sponsorship Transfer (نقل الخدمات - نقل الكفالة)
sections.text: Worker sponsorship transfer requires three-party approval: (1) New employer initiates request, (2) Current employer approves release, (3) Worker must log in and approve; otherwise status remains 'العامل لم يوافق على الطلب في حسابه'. Eligibility checks include: Iqama validity, no travel bans, no security cases, establishment quota availability (Nitaqat). Process ensures worker consent and prevents forced transfers. Worker approves via Absher > Labor Services > Transfer Requests.

sections.title: Service Payment Balance Inquiry (الاستعلام عن رصيد مدفوعات الخدمات)
sections.text: Absher provides a prepaid balance feature for government service payments. Users can view balance, recent deductions, and expiry (if any). Top-ups done through SADAD or bank channels. Balance can be used for various government services. Benefits include faster processing and reduced payment delays.

sections.title: National Address Registration - Wasel (العنوان الوطني - واصل)
sections.text: National address registration is mandatory for document delivery services. Registration via Wasel platform or Absher integration. Address becomes active within about one hour. Required for passport, ID, family registry, and document deliveries. Address includes building number, street, district, city, postal code, and additional number.

sections.title: Absher Platform Types and Access (أنواع منصات أبشر)
sections.text: Absher consists of: (1) Absher Individuals for citizens, residents, and visitors; registration requires ID number, mobile number, email, and activation. (2) Absher Business for companies, handling sponsorship, employee services, and establishment-level transactions. (3) Absher Government enabling inter-agency integrations. Available on web and mobile apps.

sections.title: Document Delivery Service - SPL (توصيل الوثائق عبر البريد السعودي)
sections.text: Saudi Post (SPL) provides delivery of government-issued documents including passports, IDs, family registries, driving licenses, and vehicle registrations. User selects delivery option in Absher; delivery fees are displayed by the system. Document is collected from issuing authority and delivered to national address. Tracking available through SPL or Absher.

sections.title: Exceptional Travel Permits (تصاريح السفر الاستثنائية)
sections.text: During special circumstances, travel may require exceptional permits. Types vary based on purpose: medical, diplomatic, educational, employment, commercial, and others. Application submitted via Absher > Messages and Requests Center. Documentation required depends on permit type. Processing time varies and notifications sent through Absher and SMS.

sections.title: Military Personnel Travel Permit Inquiry (الاستعلام عن تصريح سفر العسكريين)
sections.text: Military personnel may check travel permit status using Absher. Required inputs: military number or national ID. System displays permit status, validity, allowed destinations, restrictions, issue/expiry dates, and number of allowed trips. Real-time updates ensure accuracy before travel.

sections.title: Common Absher Error Codes and Messages
sections.text: ERR_LIC_VALIDITY_OVER: 'المدة المتبقية من صلاحية رخصة القيادة أكثر من 365 يومًا'. ERR_MED_REPORT_MISSING: 'عفواً، لا يمكن التجديد لعدم توفر التقرير الطبي'. ERR_MED_REPORT_EXPIRED: Medical report expired. ERR_TRAFFIC_VIOLATIONS: 'توجد مخالفات مرورية يجب سدادها أولاً'. VEH_INSPECT_INVALID: 'الفحص الدوري منتهي الصلاحية'. VEH_INSURANCE_MISSING: Missing vehicle insurance. VIS_PASSPORT_LOW: 'صلاحية الجواز أقل من المدة المطلوبة'. RES_INSURANCE_MISS: 'لا يوجد تأمين طبي ساري في مجلس الضمان'. AUT_EXT_VISA_ERR: 'المفوض له (مقيم) لديه خروج نهائي'. TRF_WORKER_PENDING: 'العامل لم يوافق على الطلب في حسابه'. FAM_REG_NOT_SAUDI: 'هذه الخدمة متاحة للمواطنات السعوديات فقط'. Each error includes guidance on fixing the underlying issue.

sections.title: Absher External System Integrations
sections.text: Absher integrates with many government systems: (1) Efada for medical reports, (2) SADAD for payments, (3) CCHI for health insurance verification, (4) Najm for vehicle insurance verification, (5) Mujaz for vehicle inspection certificates, (6) National Information Center for identity and family data, (7) MHRSD for work permits and Nitaqat quotas, (8) Ministry of Justice for marriage and legal records, (9) Traffic Department databases for violations and vehicle status, (10) Saudi Post (SPL) for document delivery. Integrations include secure APIs, encryption, and fallback mechanisms.

sections.title: Absher Security and Authentication
sections.text: Absher applies multi-layer security: (1) Nafath biometric authentication, (2) Two-factor authentication via SMS, (3) Session timeout and device logout controls, (4) TLS 1.3 encryption, (5) Detailed audit logging with timestamps and IP addresses, (6) Role-based and attribute-based access controls, (7) AI-powered fraud detection, (8) Privacy protections including data masking. Complies with Saudi cybersecurity regulations and international standards.

sections.title: Absher Mobile Applications
sections.text: Absher mobile apps for iOS and Android support biometric login, push notifications, offline viewing, quick shortcuts, QR document codes, scanning via camera, secure payments, multilingual support, and accessibility features. App syncs with the web platform. Includes dark mode, widgets, and regular security updates.

sections.title: Absher Customer Support and Help
sections.text: Support channels include: in-app Help Center with step-by-step guides, 24/7 call center, social media assistance (@Absher), email support, live chat, and feedback system. Common issues handled include login problems, service errors, payment issues, delegation questions, and document tracking.

sections.title: General Requirements for All Absher Services
sections.text: Common prerequisites: (1) Valid identity document (national ID or Iqama), (2) Registered mobile number for OTPs, (3) National address for document delivery, (4) Nafath biometric enrollment for secure operations, (5) No outstanding legal restrictions or violations, (6) Accurate and updated personal data, (7) Valid payment method. Technical requirements: modern browser, stable internet, JavaScript enabled. Mobile requirements: up-to-date iOS or Android version.
